Historical Conflicts & Wars.name: Echoes of Valor: A Historical Conflict Quiz
Historical Conflicts & Wars.description: Test your knowledge of pivotal moments and figures in history's most significant conflicts. From Joan of Arc to the Line of Death, this quiz explores a range of wars and their impact.

questions.text: In what war did Joan of Arc fight?
questions.hint: This conflict lasted over a century, involving England and France.

questions.text: During what war did Francis Scott Key write the words to 'The Star-Spangled Banner'?
questions.hint: This conflict involved a famous battle at Fort McHenry in Baltimore.

questions.text: Which one of these World War II leaders was not at the Yalta Conference?
questions.hint: This Italian dictator was not a key Allied or Soviet leader at the 1945 meeting.

questions.text: During which war did US troops fight the Battle of New Orleans?
questions.hint: This battle took place after the signing of a peace treaty, in early 1815.

questions.text: In 1986, Libyan leader Muammar Qaddafi drew a so-called 'Line of Death' over what body of water?
questions.hint: This body of water is part of the Mediterranean, near Libya's coast.

questions.text: Which of these countries was not a member of the Axis nations during World War II?
questions.hint: This country remained neutral under a dictator during the war.

questions.text: Who led the 1831 slave insurrection in Southampton, Virginia?
questions.hint: This leader’s name is associated with a rebellion that shook the antebellum South.

questions.text: Which one of these world leaders was assassinated?
questions.hint: This Indian prime minister was killed by her bodyguards in 1984.
